page.title: 19Traditional crafts in Evie
page.content: There is a growing interest in crafts { SPINNING:}The wool is first{carded (combed) between flat boards with a mat of sharp teeth called{cards.}It's then made into a{rolag}(approx. 9" roll) and is ready for spinning. As the{bobbin}revolves on the pedal- powered wheel the wool is twisted into a yarn. The yarn is wound onto a {niddy-noddy}and forms a{skein}(hank) which is washed before being made into a ball and knitted. { STRAW-WORK:}Articles are made from golden straw which has been hand or binder cut. The outer skin is removed and the straw passed through a ring to keep an even tension. Rounds of straw are sewn in place, each being secured to the previous row using a sailmakers needle and cotton twine. { Hand-knitting, embroidery, wood-work, {macrame, sewing}and{crochet}are done.
